course_title: Topics in Black Women's Studies: Black Motherhood
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Title: 
Black Motherhood
Course Description: 
Why are black mothers are three times more likely to die after childbirth than white mothers? This course uses literature and film to examine how race and class influence the representation and the lives of black mothers.
course_description: The course examines how constructions of race and gender control the way black women are represented in literature, film and popular culture from the 19th c. to the present. Students will look carefully at American and Western ideologies of black women.
sections: Class Nbr: 1899, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: K. Wallace-Sanders, Status: Open
